Description: Body fragment of East Greek black-figured pottery amphora. Clay: yellow-red. Outside: on left, tail of a bird to left; to right, outstretched hand(?) and other traces; inside reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 62, no. 22, p. 26)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.025)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2956 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
Miscellaneous number: VII.22 (cat. no. in Prins de Jong 1925)
